org.jboss.aerogear.android.pipeline

Class PipeManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jboss.aerogear.android.pipeline.PipeManager

  • public class PipeManager
extends Object
    A Manager which handles the registration of configurations and references to created pipes.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • registerConfigurationProvider

        public static <CFG extends PipeConfiguration<CFG>> void registerConfigurationProvider(Class<CFG> configurationClass,
                                                                      org.jboss.aerogear.android.ConfigurationProvider<CFG> provider)
        This will add a new Configuration that this Manager can build Configurations for.
        Type Parameters:
        CFG - the actual Configuration type
        Parameters:
        configurationClass - the class of configuration to be registered
        provider - the instance which will provide the configuration.

      • config

        public static <CFG extends PipeConfiguration<CFG>> CFG config(String name,
                                              Class<CFG> pipeConfigurationClass)
        Begins a new fluent configuration stanza.
        Type Parameters:
        CFG - the Configuration type.
        Parameters:
        name - an identifier which will be used to fetch the Pipe after configuration is finished. See : getPipe(java.lang.String)
        pipeConfigurationClass - the class of the configuration type.
        Returns:
        a PipeConfiguration which can be used to build a Pipe object.

      • getPipe

        public static Pipe getPipe(String name)
        Fetches a named pipe
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Pipe given in config(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class)
        Returns:
        the named Pipe or null

      • get

        public static LoaderPipe get(String name,
             android.app.Activity activity)
        Look up for a pipe object. This will wrap the Pipe in a Loader.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the actual pipe
        activity - the activity whose lifecycle the loader will follow
        Returns:
        the new created Pipe object

             android.content.Context applicationContext)
        Look up for a pipe object. This will wrap the Pipe in a Loader.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the actual pipe
        fragment - the Fragment whose lifecycle the activity will follow
        applicationContext - the Context of the application.
        Returns:
